name: ICE, ICE, Baby v0.1
description: Basic HB Glacier Deck. Not much to say. Help and critique are welcomed.

name: Networking with the Professor
description: With Leprechaun out, I finally got around to working on The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge. It still seems one turn too slow, hitting 5ish points before losing to the corp. This version dropped Savoir-faire in favor of Deus X after playing a few against Jinteki. I really think the professor's time is here, this version of the deck has an answer to just about anything. 37 influence spent! The main idea is to use Professional Contacts to draw up, use Modded to get programs out early, toss anything you don't need to Freelance Coding Contract, and use Scavenge to throw out your fixed breakers and used up Imp or D4v1d for something more useful. Ideal late game setup has 1 Djinn and 3 Leprechaun out. I spent the Prof's 1 influence on Networking. I see it most games and it works wonders as a tag management and economic card for this deck.

name: New Runner Deck
description: I originally built this around activating monolith, but couldn't quite get it to work out. Bank hard and fast, get out your dirty tricks and don't be afraid to trash. Lots of recursion here.

name: Man man man
description: Aim for turn 1 1x rabbit hole starting hand, grain 1 cred, install all three, run. Target Atman at 4,2,0 fill in holes with parasite, d4d1d; use credits from cyber feeder, spinal modem to install Atman on corp turn.

name: Andy and the Oracle
description: 84% hit rate for Oracle May or Hostage (with mulligan).

name: The Royal Tax
description: The Queen demands her tax.

name: Toolbox
description: Work in Progress

name: Toolbox V1.1
description: Work in Progress

name: NoiseShop v1.2
Stop Cheating
description:
BIG ice. and NEXT ice.

12 cards to cheat out the BIG ones.

standard operation economy.

overwriter to threaten the runner when you IAA and they can break.

1 biotic cause biotic.

name: KIT 1.0
description: Work in progress

name: I want YOU for Weyland Consortium
description:
New deck with an old identity. I have included the new Will-o'-the-Wisp which can be really nasty, as well as the Weyland current Paywall Implementation which is also a transaction. In addition to it the deck has The Root as a powerful source of credits. In the ice section I have included three copies of the Data Raven as well as three nice Snare! to have some reliable means of tag the runner.

And of course I also have some meat damage operations, this is Weyland guys, we love the smell of fried meat...

name: Ice destroyer
Reina's Underworld
description:
The deck is built on link allowing you to use underworld and get real value out of spinal at very low risk.

With the link str high this also allows me to use Creeper and ZU.13 without using MU and gives me some backup breakers incase of no datasucker's or Lotus Filed.

With spinal down plus underworlds pumping out creds each turn and a fixed breaker suite down runs become next to nothing if not nothing to do plus d4v1d can deal with large threats for free.

name: SlySquid's Pawnshop v3.2
description: With the help of my friend from The Fall Guys Dien, here are a few new changes Had to go back to Wyrm, I didn't have it and I'm so use to playing with it... I know a lot of people hate on it but it's really REALLY strong against low ice and brutal when paired with Parasite... Also any extra copy's can be Aesop's Pawnshoped out for cash!

name: Overmind Breakthrough
description: Deck is designed to harvest a lot of memory and conquer ice while using as few credits as possible with the use of Overmind in the early game. By the time the late game roles around Alpha and Omega are in play thanks to Personal Workshop and you have a rig that can take down just about anything.

name: Free Your Mind
The World is (not) Yours
description:
Idea of the deck is to tag until they can't deal with the amount of tags anymore.

Then at that point their board becomes under your control through bad times, closed accounts, and information overload.

The world then becomes your oyster not theirs.

name: Dec@Day.08 - Talk Isn't Cheap
description:
Dec@Day - Every identity, one day and deck at a time. It's like NaNoWriMo for Netrunner! More info in my profile.

Welcome to Genesis! Poor Stronger Together was a coaster for the longest time - why wouldn't you use the Base Set identity? Thankfully, one recent card changes everything: Heinlein Grid. The now Yog-resistent Viktor 1.0 becomes a terrifying ICE. Eli 1.0 becomes a true wall, and Ichi 1.0 turns into a highwayman - "Your Credits or your Program's Life!" Mother Goddess works well too--it becomes a Bioroid by association, after all.

Ideally, setting up a Bioroid Efficiency Research'd Wotan or Janus 1.0 with a Heinlein Grid and Caprice Nisei should cause most Runners to really wonder if a server is worth going for. Combine it with Project Wotan counters and Tyr's Hand for added uncertainty!

Questions, comments, or suggestions? Feel free--I'm doing this to help my deckbuilding skills, and any feedback helps. Bonus deck later on today - Sword of Damocles Redux--and come back tomorrow for another unloved Identity, the Master Gamer.

Previous Dec@Day Decks:

  • 01 HB: EtF - Fix It in Beta
  • 02 An: Noise - Trojan Whale
  • 03 Ji: PE - Sword of Damocles
  • 04 Cr: Gabe - By Hook or By Crook
  • 05 NBN: MN - Watching Out for You
  • 06 Sh: Kate - The Art Thief
  • 07 We: BaBW - Surcharges Apply

name: Q-Test
description:
Play aggressively drawing on your first click until you get Duggars or John install it and play everything in your hand, and then activate it.

Lucky find and Queens gambit for quick econ recovery

Ice Analyzer is great as your going to be face checking a load before you install anything.

Rig will usually consist of Overmind and D4v1D using scavenge to recycle either, knights are for exerting pressure on harder bits of ice early game, don't expect them to last long.

Public Sympathy makes your Duggars more worthwhile and negates a little bit of stimhack and celebral overwriter damage.

name: Jinteki PE
New Corp Deck
Knights of Trans-human Transylvania
description:
This is a highly experimental deck where i use knights instead of femme in a kit deck.

Looking for feedback. Do not really play kit.

name: Mutating Bioroids 2.3
description: Credit to x3r0h0ur

name: Mac Cache
description: The winning runner deck in a ST-tournament in Örebro, Sweden, 14.09.06. Usual Katman-shell with Aesop's and Cache, enabling influence for Imp (dropping Lucky Find). Credits to Apo on stimhack, and the discussion in the big shaper control deck-thread.

name: Anatomy of Bird Lady
Anarchy Evolved
description:
An adaptation of my deck I put together that ran Grappling Hook instead of Clone Chips - the hook felt redundant, and I figured that influence was better spent elsewhere. D4v1d and Ice Carver take a LOT of pressure off the once fairly neutered Darwin, and a well-timed Surge with IC out can create a 4-strength swing. And with Knight and Overmind, the corp needs to adjust to constant pressure, not just when Darwin is up to strength.

Cards I'd like to include if possible include Imp and/or Demo Run. For now, I'm relying on a one-off Keyhole to get in and wreck R&D, so we'll have to see how that goes in testing.

name: Off The Solar Grid v2.0
description:
This version drops Oversight AI, and takes a critical look at Amazon Industrial Zone, both of which function as pseudo-economy engines. Strong consideration needs to be given to the fact that Amazon + Blue Sun's ability = 1 Beanstalk Royalties with an entry barrier equal to the cost of the piece of ice, which in this deck could be as high as 14 credits. The draw though for AIZ is that, if left alone, it functions as this deck's version of the "infinite Adonis" that many Blue Sun decks are trying to pull off (cute, but not worth the influence/ice protection; Weyland has been doing just fine without Adonis Campaign up until this point). It's true that Amazon, even while protected by Off The Grid, won't yield as much money as quickly. At a rez of 4, and a net of 3 from Blue Sun, it wouldn't be until the third piece of ice you return that you get profit greater than the one-click pop of a Beanstalk. So why include it?

Tempo. For the first time, Weyland has the pieces to establish a longer form of tempo and set the pace of the game. Whereas before, tempo in most Weyland match-ups was dictated by how quickly the runner hit a Snare, or how many juicy programs they had out when they face-checked that Archer, this deck can force the runner over multiple turns into a series of lose-lose situations. Crisium Grid is the key to making this happen. In order to trash off the grid, the runner must first make a run on HQ (which you can load with taxing/tagging ice), trash Crisium, and then make another successful run back through. With two Data Ravens over HQ, the runner has to end the turn with a tag providing they don't have an NACH on the table. And an early Data Raven over an Amazon Industrial Zone will force the runner to deal with both the trash and the tag, or risk letting you have what has become the new version of Weyland drip econ.

I don't know yet whether it's wrong to leave out Oversight AI here because it is a bunch of free money (especially in the version of this deck that used to run Janus), but I'm trying this tax and tag variant for now and seeing what happens. I'd love feedback!!

name: Fast as I can
description: Focus on running the centrals efficiently. if you pull notoriety or Quest Completed spend a few turns building to make the run effective.

name: Dec@Day.Redux - Sword of Damocles 2.0
description:
Dec@Day - Every identity, one day and deck at a time. It's like NaNoWriMo for Netrunner! More info in my profile.

In hindsight, my previous Jinteki deck was pretty ill-focused if flatlining was the goal. I removed the less-than-ideal ICE choices...and really couldn't find any that worked. So...in went three copies of Scorched Earth, and Cerebral Cast alongside. If they take the tag, thinking it's the better course of action...we're ready to wreck them.

Giraffe is gone, replaced by Medical Research Fundraiser. Agenda-wise, the Clone Retirements and Profiteering have been exchanged for NAPD Contracts, since it gives better agenda density AND resists stealing--both of which are quite nice indeed. The other major notable addition is Psychic Field, another card that, if it triggers, can help win games all on its own.

Questions? Comments? Suggestions? Feel free--the entire reason I do this is to help my deck-building skills.

Previous Dec@Day Decks:

  • 01 HB: EtF - Fix It in Beta
  • 02 An: Noise - Trojan Whale
  • 03 Ji: PE - Sword of Damocles
  • 04 Cr: Gabe - By Hook or By Crook
  • 05 NBN: MN - Watching Out for You
  • 06 Sh: Kate - The Art Thief
  • 07 We: BaBW - Surcharges Apply
  • 08 HB: ST - Talk Isn't Cheap

name: Nauty Secrets 3.5
description:
I've been working on this deck on and off this is the currant state off affairs. Mainly the idea is to use the never advance strategy and only use fast advance later as a last resort. set up a remote and leave stuff in it edge/agenda/GRNDL. dump the shocks and Shi.Kyu in archive to keep em out of their, and Susan can protect a server pretty much on her own.

Reclamation is purely for getting either cash cards/tricks back.

*As a side note i am trying not use cards in my HB deck so i don't have to faff about changing over from one to the other so no Jackson / NAPD's 3x core cards are fine though cos i have 2 core sets.

name: Noise in da house
The NEXT Foundry v2.1 - A primer
description:
v2.1 - (Scroll down for UPGRADES)

My take on The Foundry is a Red Coats style deck featuring the NEXT ice and Domestic Sleepers with lots of 3 pointers.

Initial reactions:

1) Original concept needed more card draw so I added 2 Blue Level Clearance. There was a series of turns where I needed to draw agendas and was not.

2) One scored Domestic Sleepers is enough with this agenda set, and 2 scored doesn't help the corp, so agenda composition is all 3 pointers and now 2 Domestic Sleepers.

3) Aside from expensive "one of's", core ice should be pairs or triplets.

4) Our identity increases agenda density because we remove extra ice from R&D therefore defending it is important. (We have built in Indexing protection - with either unrezzed ice on R&D or a Chimera).

5) Grail ice with this identity will be effective because ice in hand are never dead cards. NEXT and Grail together with Mother Goddess will be very efficient and effective.

6) This identity naturally protects HQ because extra ice can just be held to make space. (Celebrity Gift is an economy option)

7) Our identity wants to rez ice, which means the runner needs to run. If the runner tries to just focus one server they can potentially deplete money and then pressure other servers unhindered. Amazon Industrial Zone counters this, allowing the ability to proc on the runner AND corp's turn. It is also a nice economy option and can get an oppressive scoring remote established.

8) This identity can theoretically allow us to run fewer ice and be fine, thus freeing up deck slots. Someone with a more mathematical mind than me should crunch some numbers.

Economy: Since this is a Red Coats style deck, and is not HB:EtF, extra economy cards were added. Sometimes the game state demands the corp "turtle up" so aside from installing ice, the economy should be click efficient. Adonis Campaign requires no clicks to use and can be initially set up in a scoring server. Same with Private Contracts except you can control how quickly you drain it and is also effective in a scoring server. Melange Mining Corp. is an experiment, but it forces the runner to deal with it, which means you will probably rez ice to defend it.

UPGRADES:

v2.1 - With First Contact dropping in a few days, I have made some updates. I have taken out Eli 1.0 to try out Galahad and Lancelot. Doing so required me to cut Tenma Line. I only drew it once or twice in testing and I never needed to use it. Punitive Counterstrike has killed several unsuspecting runners. Sometimes 2 are required to flat line the runner, so I have increased the count to 3. I ran into an issue of drawing all of the Ichi's and Inazuma while needing ETR ice. With the shift towards Grail ice, Inazuma has been taken out. I have also dropped down to 2 Amazon Industrial Zone, because they are obnoxious to draw when there is an established scoring remote and I'm click-drawing for agendas. Blue Level Clearance has performed admirably, however I feel 2 is still the correct number. A Project Wotan will probably turn into a Hades Fragment when it comes out because there are only 3 bioroid ices in the deck excluding Mother Goddess.

name: Stealth Kate
description:
Stealth based kate. All that hardware is 1 to install, so you're sure going to use her ability. Drawing a 1 cost hardware with procon basically pays for itself. Daily casts' drip helps install more than 1 per turn, and eventually all the stealth gear pays entirely for runs. Had 2 toolbox, might reslot them depending on how it plays.

Blackat is the breaker that lets you pay real credits no matter what, so you can reserve stealths as needed. Ghost runner sits in hand acting like a stealth credit stimhack for your breakers. Big R&D lock deck, with strong ability to run and rerun remotes.

name: I Mean No Harm
description:
It crossed my head if its was possible to build a deck using only neutral cards. Well, it is and this deck sucks, but I'm gonna try it out anyway. Anyone else with ideas to make a better deck using only neutrals, please comment.

I chose Andy only for the higher chance of seeing Crypsis asap.

name: Painting With Quetzal
description: I wanted to do something a little different from the ordinary with Quetzal. though E3's i think are just going to be a staple for her i wanted to get away from the Knight, Overmind approach and look at using paintbrush with fixed breakers and her ability.

name: Iain's Got Connections
description:
Have you ever wanted to play Calling In Favors for 15 credits? Well, now you can.

Before anyone asks, Helpful AI turns on Underworld Contacts and can be Hostage'd.
